com.pb.sawdust.util

Class MathUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.MathUtil

  • public class MathUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    The MathUtil provides utility methods for dealing with numbers and math.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_ALMOST_EQUALS_DELTA

        public static final double DEFAULT_ALMOST_EQUALS_DELTA
        The default delta used by the "almost equals" methods. Two non-zero values, v1 and v2, are almost equal if ||v1 - v2|/v1| < delta.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_EQUALS_ZERO_EPSILON

        public static final double DEFAULT_EQUALS_ZERO_EPSILON
        The default epsilon used by the "almost equals" methods. A value, v1 is almost equal to zero if |v1| < epsilon.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public MathUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • almostEquals

        public static boolean almostEquals(float expected,
                   float actual,
                   float delta,
                   float epsilon)
        Determine if two float values are almost equal. Two non-zero values, v1 and v2, are almost equal if ||v1 - v2|/v1| < delta. If either of the values are zero, then the values are almost equal if the absolute value of the other value is less than epsilon.
        Parameters:
        expected - The expected value.
        actual - The actual value.
        delta - The delta to use in the almost equals calculation.
        epsilon - The epsilon to use in the almost equal calculation.
        Returns:
        true if the values are almost equal, false if not.

      • almostEquals

        public static boolean almostEquals(float expected,
                   float actual)
        Determine if two float values are almost equal within the default delta DEFAULT_ALMOST_EQUALS_DELTA and the defaul epsilon DEFAULT_EQUALS_ZERO_EPSILON. Two non-zero values, v1 and v2, are almost equal if ||v1 - v2|/v1| < delta. If either of the values are zero, then the values are almost equal if the absolute value of the other value is less than epsilon.
        Parameters:
        expected - The expected value.
        actual - The actual value.
        Returns:
        true if the values are almost equal, false if not.

      • almostEquals

        public static boolean almostEquals(double expected,
                   double actual,
                   double delta,
                   double epsilon)
        Determine if two double values are almost equal. Two non-zero values, v1 and v2, are almost equal if ||v1 - v2|/v1| < delta. If either of the values are zero, then the values are almost equal if the absolute value of the other value is less than epsilon.
        Parameters:
        expected - The expected value.
        actual - The actual value.
        delta - The delta to use in the almost equals calculation.
        epsilon - The epsilon to use in the almost equal calculation.
        Returns:
        true if the values are almost equal, false if not.

      • almostEquals

        public static boolean almostEquals(double expected,
                   double actual)
        Determine if two double values are almost equal within the default delta DEFAULT_ALMOST_EQUALS_DELTA and the defaul epsilon DEFAULT_EQUALS_ZERO_EPSILON. Two non-zero values, v1 and v2, are almost equal if ||v1 - v2|/v1| < delta. If either of the values are zero, then the values are almost equal if the absolute value of the other value is less than epsilon.
        Parameters:
        expected - The expected value.
        actual - The actual value.
        Returns:
        true if the values are almost equal, false if not.

      • almostEquals

        public static boolean almostEquals(java.lang.Object expected,
                   java.lang.Object actual,
                   double delta,
                   double epsilon)
        Determine if two values are almost equal. Two non-zero values, v1 and v2, are almost equal if ||v1 - v2|/v1| < delta. If either of the values are zero, then the values are almost equal if the absolute value of the other value is less than epsilon. If the expected and actual values are not both Double or both Float instances, then equality is determined using expected.equals(actual).
        Parameters:
        expected - The expected value.
        actual - The actual value.
        delta - The delta to use in the almost equals calculation.
        epsilon - The epsilon to use in the almost equal calculation.
        Returns:
        true if the values are almost equal, false if not.

      • almostEquals

        public static boolean almostEquals(java.lang.Object expected,
                   java.lang.Object actual)
        Determine if two values are almost equal within the default delta DEFAULT_ALMOST_EQUALS_DELTA and the defaul epsilon DEFAULT_EQUALS_ZERO_EPSILON. Two non-zero values, v1 and v2, are almost equal if ||v1 - v2|/v1| < delta. If either of the values are zero, then the values are almost equal if the absolute value of the other value is less than epsilon. If the expected and actual values are not both Double or both Float instances, then equality is determined using expected.equals(actual).
        Parameters:
        expected - The expected value.
        actual - The actual value.
        Returns:
        true if the values are almost equal, false if not.
